title: أَقْسَامُ الْعَلَم
description: Learn about the different types of proper nouns in Arabic: العلم المنقول، العلم المرتجل، العلم بالغلبة، اللقب، and الكنية.

notes.title: What is العلم?
content: العَلَم (proper noun) is a noun that designates a specific entity without needing a qualifier. It can be for people (مُحَمَّد), places (مَكَّة), or things (الْقُرْآن).
Proper nouns are مَعْرِفَة (definite) by themselves without needing أَلْ or إضافة. They are divided into several types based on their origin.

examples.english: The proper noun is definite by itself

notes.title: العلم المنقول
content: العَلَم المَنْقُول is a proper noun transferred from another word class. It can be transferred from: فعل (يَزِيد from the verb 'increases'), صفة (حَسَن from 'beautiful'), مصدر (فَضْل from 'virtue').
Most Arabic names are منقول - they had an original meaning before becoming names.

notes.title: العلم المرتجل
content: العَلَم المُرْتَجَل is a proper noun coined originally as a name, not transferred from another word. These are relatively rare in Arabic.
Examples include some ancient Arab names whose original meanings are unknown or were created specifically as names.

examples.english: Coined names are few in Arabic

notes.title: العلم بالغلبة
content: العَلَم بِالغَلَبَة is when a common noun or description becomes associated with one specific entity so strongly that it becomes a proper noun for that entity.
الكِتَاب (The Book) = القرآن, المَدِينَة (The City) = المدينة المنورة, ابن عَبَّاس = عبدالله بن عباس specifically.

notes.title: اللقب
content: اللَّقَب is a nickname or title that indicates praise (مَدْح) or blame (ذَمّ). Examples: الصِّدِّيق (the truthful - Abu Bakr), الفَارُوق (the distinguisher - Umar).
When الاسم and اللقب come together, اللقب should follow: زَيْدٌ الصِّدِّيقُ (not الصِّدِّيقُ زَيْدٌ).

notes.title: الكنية
content: الكُنْيَة is a name using أَبُو (father of) or أُمّ (mother of), like أَبُو بَكْر, أُمّ سَلَمَة. It can be a real parent-child relationship or honorific.
الكنية is common in Arab culture and can be used even before having children. The order is: الكنية، ثم الاسم، ثم اللقب.

exercises.prompt: الْعَلَمُ الْمَأْخُوذُ مِنْ كَلِمَةٍ أُخْرَى يُسَمَّى الْعَلَمَ _____
exercises.promptEn: A proper noun taken from another word is called العلم _____

exercises.prompt: الْعَلَمُ الَّذِي وُضِعَ ابْتِدَاءً اسْمًا يُسَمَّى الْعَلَمَ _____
exercises.promptEn: A proper noun coined originally as a name is called العلم _____

exercises.prompt: «الْكِتَابُ» إِذَا أُرِيدَ بِهِ الْقُرْآنُ يُسَمَّى عَلَمًا بِـ_____
exercises.promptEn: 'The Book' when meaning Quran is called a proper noun by _____
'Abu Bakr' is called _____ because it begins with 'Abu'
'Yazid' is a proper noun transferred from a _____

exercises.answer: Transferred proper noun (from verb, adjective, etc.)
Proper noun by predominance (like الكتاب = القرآن)
Teknonym using Abu/Umm/Ibn (أبو بكر، أم سلمة)

exercises.prompt: Proper noun coined originally as a name
When a common noun becomes a proper noun by strong association
